Description: Two long fragments of woollen tapestry band (single warp threads), (a) and (b), and part of a matching woollen, tapestry roundel (c); Once attached to linen textile; Red ground with two alternating stylised motifs, a flower bud seen from the side? and a branching stem, in pale blue, orange, yellow and dark blue wool and undyed linen (missing); Dark blue border with repeating stylised buds or petals in the same colours; Warp: S spun, c.14 tpc; Weft: S spun, c.70 tpc; Edges: cut or ragged
Curator's comments: Previous location cupboard 64, blue box; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (2.8.1990)
Condition: Medium; Colour good but fragmentary; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
